title: Recommendations for Planting Into Cover Crops

tasks.task: Operating farm equipment to plant through cover crops.
subtasks: Setting up planter for cover crop planting.
Adjusting planter settings to handle cover crop biomass.
Ensuring soil is dry enough for planting.
Managing cover crop dormancy (dead or live) during planting.
Dealing with hairpinning caused by difficult cutting through cover crops.
Properly closing the seed trench after planting.
Timing herbicide application before rolling.
Ensuring proper coverage and efficacy of herbicide.

tasks.task: Using roller for cover crop management.
subtasks: Properly positioning the roller to crush cover crops.
Adjusting roller settings for optimal crimping and decomposition.
Observing carbon to nitrogen ratio effects.
Noting differences in cover crop species and planting dates.
Placing nitrogen fertilizer below cover crop.
Ensuring timely nitrogen availability for the growing crop.
